meanings.definition: Neat and orderly in appearance or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The snod room had everything in its place.
meanings.sent2: She always kept her desk snod and organized.
meanings.sent3: The snod rows of books on the shelf looked like soldiers standing at attention.
meanings.sent4: Her snod handwriting was a reflection of her meticulous nature.
meanings.sent5: The snod garden was a sight to behold, with each flower perfectly in place.

meanings.definition: A shoelace or lace for fastening a garment.
meanings.sent1: He tied his shoes with a sturdy snod.
meanings.sent2: The elegant dress had a delicate snod at the back.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally stepped on her snod and tripped over.
meanings.sent4: The snod of the corset held the dress snugly in place.
meanings.sent5: The snod of the hoodie was frayed from constant use.

meanings.sent1: She would snod up the living room before guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: He snodded his papers into a neat stack on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to snod up their toys before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: She snodded her hair into a sleek ponytail for the party.
meanings.sent5: The maid snodded the hotel room to perfection before the guests checked in.
